definition: to stir up/to provoke
to tease/to provoke/to stir up (emotions)
to lift up (sth hanging down)/to raise (hem of skirt)/to pull up (sleeve)/to sprinkle (water with cupped hands)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Inadvertently, provoke hair with his hand, give rise to cracking and spluttering noise.
sentences.chinese: 不经意间，用手撩动头发，还会产生劈里啪啦的响声。

sentences.english: Caressing your cascading long hair, singing a love song in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 把你那如瀑的长发轻轻撩动，为你唱一曲风的恋歌。

sentences.english: The romanticism of the bar enrich the night life of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 有浪漫的情怀，撩动夜的上海。

sentences.english: I know its crazy but you still can touch my heart.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这很疯狂，但你仍能撩动我的心弦。

sentences.english: The romanticism of the bar enriches the night life of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 有浪漫的情怀，撩动夜的上海。

sentences.english: Carry the exciting item around the store for 15 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 携带那些撩动人心的物品在商场里晃悠15分钟。

sentences.english: If I've never been decadent, you won't feel my sense;
sentences.chinese: 如果不曾幻想过，你就不会撩动我的心声。

definition: to provoke/to tease
heartstrings
to stir/to prod/to poke/to move sideways/to strum (on a guitar etc)
to evoke/to induce/to call to mind/to pick up with a hook
to pound/to throb
to provoke/to tease
to ripple/to undulate
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
to attract/to titillate
to provoke/to entice/to lure/to tantalize/to tease/to titillate
to move to and fro (with hand, foot, stick etc)/to fiddle with/to stir up
passing thought/an idea that comes into one's head/recollection
to raise/to lift up (curtains, clothing etc)
to stir/to lift/to set sth in motion
to stroke lightly/to caress
to fancy from afar/reverie/wild and fanciful thoughts
in love and inseparable
